title: Australian bushwalker rescued after two days in Queensland wilderness with broken leg – video
text: Neil Parker said he had to 'carry his leg' as he crawled 3km in two days to a place where he could be rescued. The experienced bushwalker broke his leg and wrist when he fell six metres down a waterfall at Mount Nebo in Queensland. 'My left foot just below my ankle, clean snapped in half,' he said. 'The whole bottom of my leg came loose.' Parker used hiking sticks to splint his leg, and took painkillers he had packed for an emergency, but said he had become emotional thinking about his family as he contemplated the possibility he would not survive
description: Neil Parker says he had to ‘carry his leg’ as he crawled 3km in two days after falling six metres down a waterfall at Mount Nebo, north-west of Brisbane
